clinical_study.brief_title: A Retrospective Study to Evaluate the Safety and Efficacy of a Nucleoside-Sparing Regimen of Darunavir, Ritonavir, and Dolutegravir
clinical_study.official_title: A Retrospective Study to Evaluate the Safety and Efficacy of a Nucleoside-Sparing Regimen of Darunavir, Ritonavir, and Dolutegravir

brief_summary.textblock: A Retrospective Study to Evaluate the Safety and Efficacy of a Nucleoside-Sparing Regimen of Darunavir, Ritonavir, and Dolutegravir

primary_outcome.description: Our first primary endpoint evaluated the percent of study subjects with an RNA <50 copies/mL at 48 weeks after initiation of the once daily two-drug regimen.

primary_outcome.measure: The Change in Serum Creatinine From Baseline to 48 Weeks.
primary_outcome.description: A second primary endpoint was evaluating the change in serum creatinine from baseline to 48 weeks for all subjects.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Mean CD4+ Cell Count From Baseline.
secondary_outcome.description: A secondary endpoint included changes from baseline in CD4+ cell counts.
10 study subjects reported an adverse event.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Grade 1 Adverse Events Reported
secondary_outcome.description: 10 study subjects reported adverse events. All adverse events reported (insomnia, diarrhea, headache) were of Grade 1 severity. There were no adverse events that led to discontinuation of the study regimen.

secondary_outcome.measure: Analysis of RNA at Time Points 24, 36 and 48 Weeks.
secondary_outcome.description: This secondary outcome measure analyzed the percentage of subjects with < 50 copies/mL RNA at time points 24, 36 and 48 weeks. The percent of subjects with an RNA < 50 copies/mL at each time point was analyzed using McNemar's test following the guidelines of the Snapshot algorithm. Missing RNA data was considered a treatment failure.

secondary_outcome.measure: Analysis of Creatinine Clearance at Time Points 24, 36 and 48 Weeks.

intervention.intervention_name: Darunavir 800 MG, Norvir 100 MG, Dolutegravir 50 MG

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- ≥18 years old
- Received a regimen of darunavir 800 mg/ritonavir 100 mg in combination with dolutegravir 50 mg QD for ≥24 weeks as documented in EMR
- Laboratory reports (CD4, viral load, SrCr) available at time points +/- 4 6 weeks from 12, 24, 36, 48 weeks from start of regimen
- Resistance data (if applicable)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Received a regimen of darunavir/ritonavir in combination with dolutegravir for <24 weeks duration
- Patients receiving darunavir/ritonavir + DTG+NRTI's
- Missing laboratory data in ≥2 study time points
- Patients missing more than five doses over two weeks prior study visit

provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

participant_flow.recruitment_details: A retrospective chart review of appoximately 400 HIV+ patients receiving treatment at an urban diverse FQHC was conducted to identify those who were receiving an NRTI-sparing regimen of DRV and DTG.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Subjects included were at least 18 years of age, receiving DRV/r + DTG QD for at least 24 weeks and had laboratory data through 48 weeks of follow up. Those excluded were not taking the study regimen, missed more than five doses of medication over two weeks prior to study visit or if there was missing lab data for 2 or more study time points.

group.title: Retrospective Chart Review
group.description: We conducted a retrospective chart review of approximately 400 HIV+ patients receiving treatment at an urban diverse FQHC to identify those who were receiving a NRTI-sparing regimen of DRV and DTG. Subjects were included if they were ≥ 18 years of age, receiving DRV/r + DTG QD for ≥ 24 weeks, and had laboratory data through 48 weeks of follow up. Subjects were excluded if they received a regimen of DRV/r in combination with DTG for <24 weeks duration, if they received DRV/r + DTG + NRTI’s, missed more than five doses over two weeks prior to study visit or if there was missing laboratory data for ≥2 or more study time points. The primary endpoints evaluated were the percent of patients with an RNA <50 copies/mL at 48 weeks after initiation of the regimen, as well as, the change in serum creatinine from baseline to 48 weeks.

group.title: Retrospective Chart Review
group.description: We conducted a retrospective chart review of approximately 400 HIV+ patients receiving treatment at an urban diverse FQHC to identify those who were receiving a NRTI-sparing regimen of DRV and DTG. Subjects were included if they were ≥ 18 years of age, receiving DRV/r + DTG QD for ≥ 24 weeks, and had laboratory data through 48 weeks of follow up. Subjects were excluded if they received a regimen of DRV/r in combination with DTG for <24 weeks duration, if they received DRV/r + DTG + NRTI’s, missed more than five doses over two weeks prior to study visit or if there was missing laboratory data for ≥2 or more study time points. The primary endpoints evaluated were the percent of patients with an RNA <50 copies/mL at 48 weeks after initiation of the regimen, as well as, the change in serum creatinine from baseline to 48 weeks.

category.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

measure.title: HIV RNA (copies/mL)
measure.description: This measurement was conducted at the start and at the conclusion of the study for each participant. The range 20 copies/mL to 1,820,101 copies/mL represents the HIV RNA range recorded in study subjects.

outcome.title: HIV RNA Quantitative Testing (Serum)
outcome.description: Our first primary endpoint evaluated the percent of study subjects with an RNA <50 copies/mL at 48 weeks after initiation of the once daily two-drug regimen.
outcome.population: 20 patients meeting the inclusion criteria were analyzed for this study. We evaluated the percentage of study subjects with an HIV RNA < 50 copies at 48 weeks after initiation of the once daily tow-drug regimen.

group.title: Retrospective Chart Review
group.description: We conducted a retrospective chart review of approximately 400 HIV+ patients receiving treatment at an urban diverse FQHC to identify those who were receiving a NRTI-sparing regimen of DRV and DTG. Subjects were included if they were ≥ 18 years of age, receiving DRV/r + DTG QD for ≥ 24 weeks, and had laboratory data through 48 weeks of follow up. Subjects were excluded if they received a regimen of DRV/r in combination with DTG for <24 weeks duration, if they received DRV/r + DTG + NRTI’s, missed more than five doses over two weeks prior to study visit or if there was missing laboratory data for ≥2 or more study time points. The primary endpoints evaluated were the percent of patients with an RNA <50 copies/mL at 48 weeks after initiation of the regimen, as well as, the change in serum creatinine from baseline to 48 weeks.

measure.title: HIV RNA Quantitative Testing (Serum)
measure.description: Our first primary endpoint evaluated the percent of study subjects with an RNA <50 copies/mL at 48 weeks after initiation of the once daily two-drug regimen.
measure.population: 20 patients meeting the inclusion criteria were analyzed for this study. We evaluated the percentage of study subjects with an HIV RNA < 50 copies at 48 weeks after initiation of the once daily tow-drug regimen.

analysis.non_inferiority_desc: The percent of patients with an RNA <50 copies/mL at each time point was analyzed using McNemar’s test following the guidelines of the Snapshot algorithm. Missing RNA data was considered a treatment failure. Change in mean serum creatinine from baseline was analyzed using Wilcoxon signed rank test.
analysis.other_analysis_desc: Change in mean CD4+ cell counts from baseline was analyzed using a paired t-test. All analyses used a p-value of less than or equal to 0.05 as significant. Statistical analyses were performed using R software, version 3.4.3.

outcome.title: The Change in Serum Creatinine From Baseline to 48 Weeks.
outcome.description: A second primary endpoint was evaluating the change in serum creatinine from baseline to 48 weeks for all subjects.

group.title: Retrospective Chart Review
group.description: We conducted a retrospective chart review of approximately 400 HIV+ patients receiving treatment at an urban diverse FQHC to identify those who were receiving a NRTI-sparing regimen of DRV and DTG. Subjects were included if they were ≥ 18 years of age, receiving DRV/r + DTG QD for ≥ 24 weeks, and had laboratory data through 48 weeks of follow up. Subjects were excluded if they received a regimen of DRV/r in combination with DTG for <24 weeks duration, if they received DRV/r + DTG + NRTI’s, missed more than five doses over two weeks prior to study visit or if there was missing laboratory data for ≥2 or more study time points. The primary endpoints evaluated were the percent of patients with an RNA <50 copies/mL at 48 weeks after initiation of the regimen, as well as, the change in serum creatinine from baseline to 48 weeks.

measure.title: The Change in Serum Creatinine From Baseline to 48 Weeks.
measure.description: A second primary endpoint was evaluating the change in serum creatinine from baseline to 48 weeks for all subjects.

outcome.title: Change in Mean CD4+ Cell Count From Baseline.
outcome.description: A secondary endpoint included changes from baseline in CD4+ cell counts.
outcome.population: For week 36 data, 6 study subjects did not have reportable data. These missing data included patient no-shows for labs and lab error (ex, lost sample, insufficient blood/serum drawn to run test).

group.title: Week 24
group.description: Data shows mean change in CD4+ cell count (cells/μL) from baseline to week 24.

group.title: Week 36
group.description: Data shows mean change in CD4+ cell count (cells/μL) from baseline to week 36.

group.title: Week 48
group.description: Data shows mean change in CD4+ cell count (cells/μL) from baseline to week 48.

measure.title: Change in Mean CD4+ Cell Count From Baseline.
measure.description: A secondary endpoint included changes from baseline in CD4+ cell counts.
measure.population: For week 36 data, 6 study subjects did not have reportable data. These missing data included patient no-shows for labs and lab error (ex, lost sample, insufficient blood/serum drawn to run test).

outcome.title: Incidence of Adverse Events.
outcome.description: 10 study subjects reported an adverse event.
outcome.population: 30% of subjects reported isomnia. 20% of subjects reported diarrhea. 15% of subjects reported headache.

group.title: Retrospective Chart Review
group.description: We conducted a retrospective chart review of approximately 400 HIV+ patients receiving treatment at an urban diverse FQHC to identify those who were receiving a NRTI-sparing regimen of DRV and DTG. Subjects were included if they were ≥ 18 years of age, receiving DRV/r + DTG QD for ≥ 24 weeks, and had laboratory data through 48 weeks of follow up. Subjects were excluded if they received a regimen of DRV/r in combination with DTG for <24 weeks duration, if they received DRV/r + DTG + NRTI’s, missed more than five doses over two weeks prior to study visit or if there was missing laboratory data for ≥2 or more study time points. The primary endpoints evaluated were the percent of patients with an RNA <50 copies/mL at 48 weeks after initiation of the regimen, as well as, the change in serum creatinine from baseline to 48 weeks.

measure.title: Incidence of Adverse Events.
measure.description: 10 study subjects reported an adverse event.
measure.population: 30% of subjects reported isomnia. 20% of subjects reported diarrhea. 15% of subjects reported headache.

outcome.title: Number of Grade 1 Adverse Events Reported
outcome.description: 10 study subjects reported adverse events. All adverse events reported (insomnia, diarrhea, headache) were of Grade 1 severity. There were no adverse events that led to discontinuation of the study regimen.
outcome.population: 20 patients were evaluted for adverse events.

group.title: Adverse Events
group.description: As per the studay protocol, an adverse event (AE) is an untoward medical occurence in a patient administered a medicinal product.

measure.title: Number of Grade 1 Adverse Events Reported
measure.description: 10 study subjects reported adverse events. All adverse events reported (insomnia, diarrhea, headache) were of Grade 1 severity. There were no adverse events that led to discontinuation of the study regimen.
measure.population: 20 patients were evaluted for adverse events.

outcome.title: Analysis of RNA at Time Points 24, 36 and 48 Weeks.
outcome.description: This secondary outcome measure analyzed the percentage of subjects with < 50 copies/mL RNA at time points 24, 36 and 48 weeks. The percent of subjects with an RNA < 50 copies/mL at each time point was analyzed using McNemar's test following the guidelines of the Snapshot algorithm. Missing RNA data was considered a treatment failure.
outcome.population: We analyzed data for all participants as indicated in the data table. There was missing data for one study subject at week 24 of the study and missing data for six study subjects at week 36 (blood draws were not completed by patients). Also, data was missing for one study subject at week 48 (blood draw not completed secondary incarceration).

group.title: Analysis of HIV RNA at Week 24
group.description: At week 24, 75% of subjects had an RNA of < 50 copies/mL. The percent of subjects with an RNA < 50 copies/mL at each time point was analyzed using McNemar's test following the guidelines of the Snapshot algorithm. Missing RNA data was considered a treatment failure.

group.title: Analysis of HIV RNA at Week 36
group.description: At week 36, 65% of subjects had an RNA of < 50 copies/mL. The percent of subjects with an RNA < 50 copies/mL at each time point was analyzed using McNemar's test following the guidelines of the Snapshot algorithm. Missing RNA data was considered a treatment failure.

group.title: Analysis of HIV RNA at Week 48
group.description: At week 48, 95% of subjects had an RNA of < 50 copies/mL. The percent of subjects with an RNA < 50 copies/mL at each time point was analyzed using McNemar's test following the guidelines of the Snapshot algorithm. Missing RNA data was considered a treatment failure.

measure.title: Analysis of RNA at Time Points 24, 36 and 48 Weeks.
measure.description: This secondary outcome measure analyzed the percentage of subjects with < 50 copies/mL RNA at time points 24, 36 and 48 weeks. The percent of subjects with an RNA < 50 copies/mL at each time point was analyzed using McNemar's test following the guidelines of the Snapshot algorithm. Missing RNA data was considered a treatment failure.
measure.population: We analyzed data for all participants as indicated in the data table. There was missing data for one study subject at week 24 of the study and missing data for six study subjects at week 36 (blood draws were not completed by patients). Also, data was missing for one study subject at week 48 (blood draw not completed secondary incarceration).

outcome.title: Analysis of Creatinine Clearance at Time Points 24, 36 and 48 Weeks.
outcome.population: There was missing data for one study subject at week 24 of the study and missing data for six study subjects at week 36 (blood draws were not completed by patients). In addition, data was missing for one study subject at week 48 (blood draw not completed secondary incarceration).

group.title: Analysis of Serum Creatinine at Week 24
group.description: There were no significant differences in creatinine clearance from baseline to 24 weeks.

group.title: Analysis of Serum Creatinine at Week 36
group.description: There were no significant differences in creatinine clearance from baseline to 36 weeks.

group.title: Analyis of Serum Creatinine at Week 48
group.description: There were no significant differences in creatinine clearance from baseline to 48 weeks.

measure.title: Analysis of Creatinine Clearance at Time Points 24, 36 and 48 Weeks.
measure.population: There was missing data for one study subject at week 24 of the study and missing data for six study subjects at week 36 (blood draws were not completed by patients). In addition, data was missing for one study subject at week 48 (blood draw not completed secondary incarceration).

reported_events.time_frame: Adverse event data was collected for a total of 3 months.

group.title: Retrospective Chart Review
group.description: We conducted a retrospective chart review of approximately 400 HIV+ patients receiving treatment at an urban diverse FQHC to identify those who were receiving a NRTI-sparing regimen of DRV and DTG. Subjects were included if they were ≥ 18 years of age, receiving DRV/r + DTG QD for ≥ 24 weeks, and had laboratory data through 48 weeks of follow up. Subjects were excluded if they received a regimen of DRV/r in combination with DTG for <24 weeks duration, if they received DRV/r + DTG + NRTI’s, missed more than five doses over two weeks prior to study visit or if there was missing laboratory data for ≥2 or more study time points. The primary endpoints evaluated were the percent of patients with an RNA <50 copies/mL at 48 weeks after initiation of the regimen, as well as, the change in serum creatinine from baseline to 48 weeks.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
